definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: These ignition wires send the charge to each spark plug.
sentences.chinese: 这些点火导线将电荷运送至每个火花塞。

sentences.english: The spark that ignited their partnership was provided by Mr. Wozniak’s mother.
sentences.chinese: 点燃两人合作之火的火花来自沃兹尼克的母亲。

sentences.english: It flamed out and fell heavily on the table.
sentences.chinese: 那机器人最终喷出火花重重地摔在桌面上。

sentences.english: Down came the hammer and out flew the sparks.
sentences.chinese: 锤子敲下来，闪出了火花。

sentences.english: He rubbed two stones together to produce sparks.
sentences.chinese: 他把两块石头相互碰擦而产生火花。

sentences.english: I've seen the dark, I've seen the brightness in one little spark.
sentences.chinese: 我见过黑暗，我见过小火花的光辉。

sentences.english: Visual and holiday detection of the bend coating.
sentences.chinese: 目测外观及火花检漏仪检测弯管防腐层。

sentences.english: The result was the plug-spark as we know it today.
sentences.chinese: 结果便发明了我们今天所熟知的那种火花塞。

sentences.english: Fireworks! Man, you hear them scratch, metal over metal.
sentences.chinese: 火花滚滚，你们听到它们相互刮擦，金属之间。

sentences.english: This spark is the strength of conviction.
sentences.chinese: 这个火花就是信念的力量。

sentences.english: Part of rekindling the spark is getting to know one another again.
sentences.chinese: 重燃婚姻的火花一部分是需要重新认识彼此。

sentences.english: This is particularly true with high-frequency spark testers that should not be used with foamed insulation.
sentences.chinese: 因此高频火花机不被应用于发泡绝缘是非常正确的。

sentences.english: Now, you may see a glimmer of hope.
sentences.chinese: 现在，您可能会看到一点希望的火花。

sentences.english: Why didn't the Lunar module show a flame when it took off from the Moon?
sentences.chinese: 为什么登月车从月球上面起飞的时候没有火花？

sentences.english: The least of man's original emanation is better than the best of borrowed thought.
sentences.chinese: 人最渺小的原创火花也比最优秀的拾人牙慧要强。

definition: (of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions/to splatter everywhere
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
